channel.title: Summary :: K-State CIS 580 Textbook
channel.description: In this chapter we learned about input polling and how it is implemented in XNA using structures representing input state and static GetState() methods. We saw the three primary forms of input we use in the MonoGame framework - the keyboard, the mouse, and the gamepad. We also saw how a variety of game controllers (i.e. RockBand gear, steering wheels, flight sticks, etc.) are mapped to the standard gamepad; how its state struct is actually composed of several sub-structs; and how to turn on and off the vibration motors.
